content: why is there no  test with uppercase input, but there is a validator(test 4) for that?

There isn't any test case with lowercase characters in its input, only validators.
It's a bad practice to introduce new elements in validators, so please update the corresponding test cases so that they also have lowercase characters.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: It is quite entertaining.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: OK but only for the clashers who are good in mathematics. I can do a code which works but it took me more than 15 minutes :-(  because i  have to go to google to see how to proceed...

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Cette contribution est juste géniale,
c'est clair, et aussi intéressant

Good afternoon, 

It looks good. I guess you can improve the text syntax a little. 

1) Usually, we do not put space before `:` in English. 

2) At some point, the text changes in format ("With this process..."  and "For example...".

3) Just for learning, I see in the solutions you regenerate the list of characters. In python, you can use: 

```
import string
string.ascii_uppercase 
```
It is longer, but way faster: 

```
In [4]: %timeit [chr(i+65) for i in range(26)]
1.29 µs ± 16.4 ns per loop (mean ± std. dev. of 7 runs, 1000000 loops each)

In [5]: %timeit import string;string.ascii_uppercase
81.9 ns ± 0.296 ns per loop (mean ± std. dev. of 7 runs, 10000000 loops each)
```

Anyway, nothing critical. 

4) Based on the last comment, I wonder if you could also add the "shortest mode" to your puzzle. 

Anyway, good job!

1. Currently no test covers the error case. Please add one and pair that with the error validator.

2. In the Goal section:
(a) Please fix the formula so it is displayed all in a single line.
(b) Please use "string" instead of "word".
(c) I know maths and I don't know what PGCD is. Please just remove that whole sentence.
(d) Please add "s" to "correspond".

3. In the Input section:
Please use "Line 1", "Line 2", etc. You may refer to the example in the contribution guidelines here: https://www.codingame.com/playgrounds/40701/help-center/statement#guidelines

4. In the Output section:
Suggest to use "correct" or "valid" instead of "possible".

5. In the Constraints section:
(a) Please format a, b and msg.
(b) Suggest the third constraint be rewritten as "1 ≤ length of [[msg]] ≤ 127".

Hello, thanks for taking time to write your comment !
That was very useful. Everything should be corrected.

- The error case is now covered also by a test.
- fixed the formula and the display overall. Everything should be formatted.
- My bad for PGCD. This notation only exists in France. I wanted to say "the greatest common divisor of a and 26 is 1". However, I removed the complete sentence because I realised it could induce somebody in error since calculating the greatest common divisor takes, to me, a lot more time than simply testing  every divisor with a modulo. 
- I simplified some words to make it more accessible to non native english speakers and replaced words that weren't clear.
- Most importantly, better banana puns and jokes

well thanks a lot for everything. I corrected everything (the space before the :, the format of the text, shortest mode). Well except the string.ascii_uppercase . I am going to do it now. I just realized I didn't do it as I'm writing. 
Also, most importantly, you can now validate the challenge :3 !!!
hello, sorry I did not connect to my account for quite a while. I corrected that.
sorry, I didn't connect to my account for a while. I corrected that. I hope you like the challenge :)
